DataElement.preferredName: Immunohistochemistry BCL2 Gene Assessment Report Outcome
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The report result for the immunohistochemistry BCL2 gene assessment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Histochemical localization of immunoreactive substances using labeled antibodies as reagents. (MSH98)_This gene is involved in apoptotic regulation. Overexpression of this gene promotes the pathogenesis of B-Cell lymphomas, due to anti-apoptotic activity._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Histochemical localization of immunoreactive substances using labeled antibodies as reagents. (MSH98)

Concepts.definition: Histochemical localization of immunoreactive substances using labeled antibodies as reagents. (MSH98)

Property.preferredDefinition: A protein that helps control whether a cell lives or dies by blocking a type of cell death called apoptosis. The gene for BCL2 is found on chromosome 18, and transfer of the BCL2 gene to a different chromosome is seen in many B-cell leukemias and lymphomas. This causes the BCL2 protein to be made in larger amounts, which may keep cancer cells from dying.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: This gene is involved in apoptotic regulation. Overexpression of this gene promotes the pathogenesis of B-Cell lymphomas, due to anti-apoptotic activity.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
